  4. I was a little skeptical to try Crest 3D White Brilliance. I have tried every whitening toothpaste and product available. They either only focus on whitening and your teeth don't feel so clean or they are so harsh that they leave your teeth so sensitive. I was intrigued that the package included two tubes; one to focus on cleaning, removing both plaque and gingivitis and the other is for whitening and polishing.<br /><br />Following the instructions, brushing with the purifying cleanser first - the taste is good, very similar to other Crest Pro Health® toothpastes. The instructions say to spit but not to rinse before applying the perfecting gel. I do not rinse my mouth but I do rinse my toothbrush to apply the perfecting gel. Be careful with this stuff - a little goes a long way! All you need is a very small dab of this stuff to work. It tastes a lot like the stuff that's on a Crest WhiteStrip, so definitely not the greatest taste in the world.<br /><br />The results are the whitest cleanest feeling teeth I have had in a long time. Running my tongue over my teeth, they feel so smooth and clean and looking in the mirror - SO WHITE! 2 minutes of brushing my teeth has whitened better than any other toothpaste I have ever used. I have continued to use this product for a little over a week now and the whiteness hasn't worn off, it just keeps getting better.<br /><br />I was lucky enough to receive this product for free from Crest. Although I did not pay for this product my review is completely my own thoughts and opinions.
  5. Got the opportunity to try out Crest 3D White Brilliance kit via a free sample from BzzAgent. I have been using this religiously for two weeks now and I gotta be honest, I didn't notice any difference. I had taken a picture the day I started and decided to take another one today and post up my review. It wasn't until I looked at the two pictures that I noticed the difference. I had yellowing towards the bottom part of my upper and lower canines and bicuspids. When you look at the picture I till today compared to the one I took initially, the yellowing is significantly less visible. I'm surprised, really. I've bought &#34;whitening&#34; toothpastes before and they have never worked so I didn't really have high expectations for this one either. But lo and behold, it actually does work. It's subtle so I suggest doing what I did and take pictures so you can see the progress.<br /><br />So aside from the whitening, one thing I noticed from day one was how clean my teeth felt and how long they lasted like that. I have never had any toothpaste leave my teeth feeling this smooth and clean. The amazing part is that they last like that the whole day, no lie. I loved that!<br /><br />The kit is also easy to use. It brings both tubes and you brush your teeth with each one for one minute, so it's not like it's extending your brushing routine or anything. All in all, I love it and I'm still in shock that the whitening actually worked!

Makes your mouth feel so clean!<br /><br />Cons: Whitening gel has a slightly bitter taste, but the mint overpowers it, so it didn't bother me at all. Reminds me of Crest's white strips.
  25. I use other Crest 3D White products and I was very excited to try the Brilliance Daily Cleansing & Whitening System, which I received from BzzAgent. I am very self conscious of my yellow teeth and always try to buy products that can approve their appearance. My teeth are also very sensitive so I have to be careful with the products I use. The Crest® 3D White™ Brilliance Daily Cleansing & Whitening System is a two step process but is very easy to use -- you brush your teeth with the Deep Cleansing Toothpaste for one minute and then brush on the Whitening Finisher. Unlike other products where you need to leave the whitening substance on for five minutes or longer, this is a very quick and efficient process.<br /><br />I have been using this system for a month and I have noticed only a very minor difference with the color I have yet to receive any compliments or remarks from others and have also felt some sensitivity when using the Whitening Finisher. I like the ease of use and I like the taste and consistency of the toothpaste but the results have much to be desired.
  26. I had the pleasure to try this product for free from Bzz Agent. I have tried teeth whitening systems in the past but my tooth sensitivity made it impossible to stay with any. I get my extra whitening in while I brush my teeth. The results are more gradual than the Crest Strips, but that's to be expected from something that takes 2 minutes versus 30 minutes.<br /><br />First you brush with the step one for 1 minute and then you brush with step 2 for one more minute.   53. After two weeks of using Crest 3D White toothpaste, I have found a slight whitening of my teeth but not as dramatic as I had hoped. To be fair, I'll continue using the product longer and am hopeful that overtime, I will see a more significant improvement.<br /><br />The positives: I did feel that the toothpaste is starting to work and I would still recommend it to friends and family to try. I believe it will be much more effective after longer use. I was afraid that it would be harmful to my teeth and gums or that it would be too abrasive and make my teeth sensitive but I did not have those problems at all. I was surprised at how mild the toothpaste was and I had no issues using it. I had negative experiences with tooth whitening products in the past and am happy to report that was not the case with Crest 3D White toothpaste.<br /><br />The not-as-positives: The toothpaste didn't taste minty like you would expect most toothpaste to taste like. It was not off-putting but if I could make a few changes, it would be to improve the taste a bit. And it also didn't &#34;bubble up&#34; like traditional toothpaste so even though I knew the toothpaste was effective, it didn't &#34;fee&#34; like it was working b/c of the lack of lather. The second step toothpaste was more of a gel and that definitely took some getting used to. I really couldn't tell if I was brushing with the gel or if it had evaporated. Again, I think it's because it didn't have that traditional &#34;feel&#34; of toothpaste foaming while you brush that made me think I was only brushing with water. But I must of been using the product, because I was starting to notice a difference! I also brushed a bit longer than the recommended minute for each paste. And lastly (and this is nit-picking really), I still wish it could have been just one step, instead of two. It was odd to have to spit after using the first tube of toothpaste without rinsing. I still haven't quit gotten used to that. It's not a huge deal but perhaps both products can be combined and still get good results.<br /><br />Overall, I may have set my expectations too high thinking I would see a vast improvement in the whitening of my teeth so soon so I'll stick with it since I did see results. (I just have to be a bit more patient). Again, I would purchase this product and recommend this to people to try.<br />[you can trust this review - tested as part of a Shopper Army mission!]

I did start using it a few weeks after I finished my box of 3D Crest Professional Effects strips (best ever), but I could tell that it kept stains at bay and made sure my teeth were extra white. I'm so much more confident with my smile now (goodbye, yellow teeth) and will def be using the system in between the whitening strips. Thank you, Crest!

  87. I was fortunate to receive a box of Crest 3D White Brilliance Daily Cleansing & Whitening System for free through Crest and BzzAgent, When I received the package I was chomping at the bit to try a new whitening product as a few months ago I had a negative experience with a professional whitening product purchased through a dentist’s office. The more, eh, intense dentist's product had created so much sensitivity in my teeth that I thought I was feeling disheartened and pessimistic about whitening products. I was also feeling frustration about my new tea habit and the stains it has been leaving on my teeth.<br /><br />When I first started researching Crest’s new product I was terribly concerned that it might contain plastic beads. Fortunately this product does not. The primary ingredients of interest are stannous fluoride in the step 1 cleanser and hydrogen peroxide in the step 2 whitening polish. The only concerns with these chemicals is a possible teeth staining from the fluoride formula and tooth sensitivity from the peroxide. Crest addresses these by 1) warning the user about the possibility of fluoride staining and 2) leaving cleansing paste on your teeth during the polish step.<br /><br />I have used the 3D White System for over two weeks now. I find that the concerns about fluoride staining and peroxide sensitivity are not an issue for me. I have experienced no staining or strange discoloration in my teeth or gums and that makes me happy. The peroxide does not give me strong cold sensitivity. There is a mild sensation of a brisk cool wind coming in my mouth during that final polishing step and during the final rinse, but I suffer no negative side effects from the whitening agent. This was a concern for me since the carbamide peroxide in my dentist’s professional products resulted in intolerable side effects for me. Crest is much milder an experience. As to the whitening effects, I have seen my teeth lighten 1-2 shades. Of course my teeth are their whitest after brushing and not after drinking tea, but I see distinct benefits from doing a whitening regimen so regularly since I have this tea habit that is constantly staining my teeth.<br /><br />What I like about the product is that it does not significantly lengthen my dental hygiene regimen. It keeps my teeth whitened regularly in spite of my regular tea habit. The multiple product tube stand upright and don’t take up much counter space. The whitening experience is not painful or complicated. I like the taste of the products (almost fruity or bubble gum like). From what I can tell, the system is not very expensive.So would I continue to use this product? Yes, with a caveat. I think that my dentist needs to be consulted before I decide to use a hydrogen peroxide treatment daily as I don’t know what that chemical does to healthy bacteria in the mouth. Last time I checked the bottle of peroxide in my medicine cabinet it said it was for dental debridement and I believe it functions as an antiseptic. The dose may be inconsequential for that purpose. I will ask during my appointment later this month. I am very glad I got to try this product!<br /><br />**To address another reviewer's claim, I'm pretty sure that abrasion is not the method Crest uses to whiten in this product. If you review the product ingredients and do a little research, there are no abrasives in the whitening polish. The only whitening agent is hydrogen peroxide (which may or may not be good as all the spendier products I've seen on the market seem to use carbamide peroxide). The only &#34;abrasive&#34; ingredients I can find are in the deep cleansing toothpaste are hydrated silica and mica. I've seen silica in tons of toothpastes, including the ones recommended by my dentist, most of which do not advertise themselves as whitening and can still have low RDA (Relative Dentin Abrasivity) values. I don't know as much about mica. A quick google search suggested that both of those substances are included to help scrape plaque off your teeth.

  97. I was lucky enough to try this product for free from Crest and BzzAgent. Based on the price, I don't believe that I would have purchased it to try on my own otherwise.<br /><br />The first step in the two part system, the toothpaste comes with a warning that the fluoride may cause staining. Right off the bat, that seems counterproductive. The chemicals used to flavor and sweeten this toothpaste leave a slightly unpleasant aftertaste in your mouth for quite a while. Step one has a very gritty texture, but none of the tiny plastic beads that tend to get caught under the gums causing irritation. After brushing for one minute with the Step One toothpaste I have noticed that my mouth feels very strange. Sort of numb and tingly, parched and dry feeling.<br /><br />The second step is a peroxide sort of gel. After brushing with Step One you are supposed to spit, and start Step Two right away. I had no problems with the second step, there was no bleaching of my gums or insides of my cheeks. I experienced no increased sensitivity even after a week or more of use. I do find myself wondering if I could just mix step one and step two in order to save time,<br /><br />I took before and after pictures at the same time of the day in the same location after two weeks of use and I am sorry to say that I did not noticed any difference in the whiteness of my teeth.
  98. As soon as I got the campaign invite through BzzAgent to try Crest's new 3D White Brilliance Daily Cleansing System, I signed up right away. I mean who doesn't want whiter teeth that doesn't cost a fortune?? I was a little intimated by the 2 part system, thinking that it was going to be too time consuming and in the end a product that I would not continue with. However, when I learned what the 2 part process actually was, I realized it’s not bad at all. I tend to brush my teeth for a longer period anyway with my Sonic Care toothbrush, and the 2 step process is quick and simple for me because the toothbrush makes a noise after 1 minute and then stops after 2 minutes. The directions tell you to brush with the Step 1 tube first, which is the Deep Cleansing Toothpaste that prepares your teeth, then spit -don't rinse (which I would tend to forget a time or two)- and then last use the Step 2 tube for the second minute being the Whitening Finisher. The product states the system together is supposed to keep your smile up to 99% as white as a professional polish. There is one big negative in my eyes, and that is the awful after taste that the product leaves in my mouth after brushing, almost making me feel sick. And the taste is still there when I wake up in the middle of the night due to a child crying or bathroom needs, and again it makes me feel sick. I even tried using mouthwash after I brushed but the bad taste still came back. I actually noticed myself after a couple weeks of use reverting back to my old toothpaste here and there to not have to deal with the awful taste. For this reason I will not be purchasing the item in the future. I also noticed that after using the product my mouth felt tingly and parched. It was definitely a weird feeling. As for the whitening results, I have not noticed a significant difference, maybe a slight change if anything. I asked my husband if he noticed a difference and he said &#34;no&#34;. So all in all, I was bummed about the productand will continue to use Crest's 3D Whitening toothpaste that I have used for years which I do highly recommend. I also have to say that I read some of the other product reviews and saw the negative comments people were saying about the ingredients in the product which is a little scary and makes me not want to use the product again. I was shocked to see how many other people noticed the bad after taste just like I did! Sorry Crest, but still happy I was able to try it for free :)

  126. So I'll start by saying that I drink TONS of coffee and tea and my teeth always have an ever so slight tint of an off-white-ish color. I started out using it twice a day and it was actually making my gums hurt a little so I went to just using it in the mornings and using a regular 3D crest toothpaste at nights. Step 1 feels a little weird at first when you're done brushing because you can't rinse your mouth out but once you get step 2 on and spit and rinse it all out, your teeth feel like they've been professionally whitened. After three days, I noticed a HUGE difference. My teeth weren't yellow before, but now they're so white I actually have people asking if I just had them whitened. My advice is to use plenty of water on your toothbrush in between steps because the peroxide or whatever is in each tube can make your mouth a little dry afterwards. But all in all, this is by far the best teeth whitening product I've used. I'm 100% confident I'll actually pay for another set when mine runs out.
  127. I was fortunate to receive a box of Crest 3D White Brilliance Daily Cleansing & Whitening System for free through Crest and BzzAgent, The smell was pleasant, unlike other competitors. For the cost, convenience, and ease of use I would recommend. I have had a positive experience so far. I will probably repurchase.
  128. I received the Crest® 3D White™ Brilliance Daily Cleansing & Whitening System from BzzAgent (free from Crest) to try out for free and review. I loved the easy 2 step system that you can complete in just 2 minutes! First- brush for 60 seconds with Step 1 to leave your teeth feeling clean. Second- brush for 60 seconds with Step 2 to whiten/polish your teeth for a professional clean feeling! I have only been using the product for about 3 weeks and have already seen results. My teeth are noticeably whiter and feel so smooth and clean. The only negative of this product is that it is a little strong and tends to burn my mouth after completing both steps. However, the effects are temporary (less than 15 seconds) and are worth the great results! I would highly recommend the Crest® 3D White™ Brilliance Daily Cleansing & Whitening System to anyone looking to gradually whiten their teeth without the expense of a professional cleaning!

  132. Thanks to bzzagent and Crest I was able to try this product for free. In this set you get two tubes. You use the first one for one minute and then you use the second one for one minute as well (let me tell you, it does discipline me and make me brush my teeth for the full two minutes).<br />I do drink a lot of coffee: at least three cups a day. Also I like Red Bull that doesn’t really help to whiten my teeth. To be honest I was a little skeptical before trying this product. I have tried so many whitening toothpastes that I can’t even put a count on it. The last one that I had been using was Rembrandt. I cannot say I loved it-I was satisfied with it. Until I tried Crest 3D brilliance Daily Cleansing and Whitening system. With Rembrandt you have to choose: either you buy the kind that works with your stains or the one that whiten your teeth. With Crest you get two in one. How awesome is that? You don’t have to make a tough decision and choose between the stains or whitening. You just buy one.<br />The only thing I regret now that I didn’t take a picture of my teeth before trying this product (well, it’s because I didn’t think I was going to get any results). I know that my teeth are at least two tones whiter than they were before but it would be nice to see it on the picture.
  133. I received this duo for free from BzzAgent. Step 1 is basically like a regular whitening toothpaste. Yes, it is a bit gritty or abrasive. All good toothpastes are and whitening toothpastes are even more abrasive so they can reive debris and help remove surface stains from your teeth. I didn't, however, find it to feel overly gritty. I thought that it had a really nice flavor also. Step 2 tastes is similar to the whitening gel you find in whitening strips. It tastes the same to me, but I don't think the taste is unbearable. It isn't great either though. This duo produces great results. I think that this could be used as a maintenance product if you use whitening strips or on its own. The results are noticeable, and I've had people comment on how white and beautiful my teeth are. The price may seem a little hefty, but I think it's really worth it.
  134. Fantastic whitening product.   183. I recently tried the Crest 3D white toothpaste system. I was able to try it free as a member of Shopper Army but all opinions remain my own.<br /><br />This toothpaste comes with two different tubes. It is a two step process. The first tube is a deep cleaning toothpaste-use this for one minute. The second step is a whitening gel that is intended to brighten and whiten your teeth. Immediately I noticed my teeth felt cleaner-after one use. Its like after a trip to the dentist clean. This is the first toothpaste I have found that makes me say that. The whitening was less noticeable for me, personally, although I do feel my teeth look brighter and less yellow.<br /><br />The two step process can be a pain-you have to open and close two different tubes of toothpaste and brush separately for one minute a piece. So, it seems longer but in essence is only two minutes. I think I have two minutes each time after I have seen the results.<br /><br />The taste is okay-its kind of plain and perhaps a little peroxide-y tasting. But, for how clean my teeth feel I don;t miss the stronger mint flavor of regular toothpaste. I think this is a great system. I have seen some people complain about sensitivity and problems using this particular system so users should be cautious, but I havee personally has no problems.   184. I've been using this stuff for about a month now. I don't find the 2 steps to be &#34;too much&#34; for my morning brushes. I actually like that it keeps me in check with spending a decent amount of time brushing my teeth! Step 1 is the cleanser and I feel a great clean when I use it. Step 2 is the whitening gel which I like to use and see my teeth look a little more sparkly after.<br /><br />Results: After using for about a month I don't notice tremendous differences in the coloring of my teeth. They have gotten slightly whiter but have not progressed since then. I feel that this stuff is only good until a certain extent of whiteness. If you are looking for tremendous changes you won't find it here. If you are looking for a shade or 2 difference, then this stuff works. Once I got to my whiteness level, I've been able to maintain with the use of this product. My guess would be that this would be a really great after-care product if you had your teeth whitened professionally as it would probably maintain really well.<br /><br />Sensitivity: While brushing, I notice certain spots in my mouth hurt a little. I think that means I have to go to the dentist honestly and have a cavity filled. Otherwise, I have not felt any sensitivity afterwards or throughout the day AT ALL. When I used the Crest White Strips I had serious sensitivity issues. Not with this stuff.<br /><br />All in all, this product did its job and I am happy. I also want to add that I have very sensitive teeth, but this product never hurt, or stung or felt weird in any way. 100% recommend.
  193. I liked this better than the Crest Pro-Health stuff I've used in the past. The first step felt grittier, which to some might seem like a bad thing but I felt like it got my teeth cleaner because it was more abrasive.<br /><br />Step two was comparable to Crest Pro-Health. I do like the two-step process, but it's hard with my electric toothbrush. My toothbrush runs for an exact amount of time, so I have to stop it in the middle (after guessing how long it's been) and then start it up again, whereupon it runs for another two minutes. So I think it might be better with a programmable or normal toothbrush, but it's not THAT hard to turn it off and on, and it's worth it for clean, white teeth!<br /><br />Thanks, Crest, for giving me a free sample!

  218. When it comes to toothpaste, I am a dedicated Crest user and have been for years. My standard Crest toothpaste has a whitening component, and while I’m sure it helps prevent stains, over time certain habits (I drink coffee and red wine often) lead to less than super bright teeth. Enter Crest 3D White Brilliance Daily Cleansing and Whitening system. The “system” involves a 2 step process, where first you brush for one minute with a Deep Cleaning Toothpaste, followed by brushing for one minute with a Whitening Finisher gel (with no rinsing in between steps). As a Crest fan, I have used Crest’s other 2-step whitening system before (Crest ProHealth HD), and I liked the results as well as the squeaky clean feeling it gave my teeth. But that system was a bit too harsh on my sensitive gums, so I had to use it for one brushing every other day instead of twice a day. Having to use my regular toothpaste routine in between slowed down my results a bit. So when I was offered a free trial system of Crest 3D White Brilliance as part of a promotion from Crest, I was happy to try it out and see if I could use it more frequently to get a faster whitened smile.<br /><br /> After using the product for about 3 weeks, I am happy with my positive results, with no gum sensitivity problems! My teeth are noticeably brighter, shinier, and overall they feel very clean, similar to the way they feel right after a cleaning at the dentist’s office. I would be likely to use this system maybe twice a year to renew my smile and re-whiten my teeth. The two step process is not a big difference from my regular one step brushing routine, and doesn’t really require any extra brushing time (2 mins total? I can live with that!). The Deep Cleaning toothpaste in the step one tube is a good consistency - it has a bit of texture to scrub the teeth nice and clean without being overly coarse or gritty. Without water, it does not foam a lot, but it doesn't feel that much different than regular toothpaste. The step 2 tube contains the whitening agent, and it doesn't have an unpleasant taste. The other 2 step system by Crest I've tried had a very bleach-y tasting whitening gel, and it actually tasted a lot like Crest white strips. The Whitening Finisher gel that comes with the Crest 3D White Brilliance system is a much more pleasant experience. One other thing I did notice with this system is that when I used it the very first time, I had white spots develop on my gums in a few areas. The instructions with the system indicated that this is not abnormal and temporary. In fact, the spots did go away in a few hours and they never came back with any later usages.<br /><br />Overall the pros of the product:<br />1. It left my teeth and mouth feeling especially clean, like it feels right after a cleaning at the dentist<br />2. It made my teeth noticeably whiter and shinier<br />3. My sensitive gums were not irritated by the product<br /><br />The only con:<br />1. It did leave some white spots on my gums after the first usage. The box says this is normal and the spots went away, but it did make me wonder a bit about what caused that and if it was good for me.<br /><br />For the most part, this product did exactly what it claimed to do, and I am enjoying my newly brighter and whiter teeth! I would definitely use this again, not as my standard toothpaste, but every so month for maintenance to keep my smile looking bright and sparkly.

Then I applied Step 2, the Whitening Finisher, to my toothbrush and brushed for 1 minute. The Finisher was more minty in flavor and was more like a gel in consistency.   235. I was able to try this product for free thanks to Crest® and Bzzagent.<br /><br />For as long as I can remember I have noticed that people seem to have a fixation with the appearance of their teeth. My mother always told me that people judge you on the appearance of your teeth. As soon as my brother and I had our first teeth come in she obsessively cared for them. I have seen a plethora of teeth whitening products in the media and in my own life. I used my first whitening strips when i was in the fifth grade and have found whitening pens in my stocking on Christmas morning.<br /><br />As my life has become busier, i have preferred to use the simplest solutions for tasks such as whitening my teeth. In theory this product does seem like a simpler solution to this problem. It should be more effective and easier than the other products I've used.<br /><br />The product is a bit simpler. I use the first step as I would any toothpaste, and that it what it feels like. The second step is a gel. It goes on similar to the toothpaste but seems somehow more liquidy. I appreciate that there is no waiting time and I can just go on immediately from it. It is nice yo not have to wait like i would with strips or a pen. It is easier in this regard, but the second step feels easy to skip or forget altogether. This is especially true for someone who is lazy in their routine or rushed. After I brush my teeth, I do not feel like brushing again.<br /><br />My other problem is the taste. For me the taste, is honestly similar the way a skunk smells. It is in no way pleasant for me and something I want to get out of my mouth immediately after I put it in. This may have contributed to my tendency to be tempted to skip the second step. Like most toothpastes I believe that crest was likely going for a mint flavor, and because I do not like he taste of mint, this could be the reason the taste bothered me. Like any mint flavor, this made my mouth burn. Although this flavor was only in the first step, and the second had more of a neutral flavor, it was hard to reach for the second step and keep brushing when my tongue was screaming for some bubblegum flavored children's mouthwash to neutralize the sting! My mother did not have this problem. When I made her taste it, she said that it tasted like candy canes. Most mint lovers would probably not have a problem with the taste, but that is my personal experience.<br /><br />Does it really whiten as well as a professional polish? I can't say for sure because ice never had a professional polish, but I can say at it does work. After a few days I could already notice a difference. My teeth look whiter and shinier. They don't look black light white, but that's probably for the best. As with any whitening product I worry about the safety, but for now I'll have to trust that Crest knows what it's doing. I give it 3/5 stars. It works, but is not something that I would purchase again.
  236. I received this toothpaste free and tried it excitedly. It is somewhat of a commitment to brushing for a period of time each time you use it since it is 2 steps and they both must be done. I found that it had a good taste, consistency wasn't so pasty but more gel like. It whitened but not a significant amount if you have a lot of discoloration.
  237. I received this set in the mail as part of a Bzz Agent campaign, and have found it to be quite comparable to other Crest 3D White products. I have also tried the mouth wash, polisher toothpaste, regular toothpaste, and white strips.<br /><br />This set is nice because it's completely manageable, takes hardly any extra effort, and doesn't leave your teeth feeling raw from over-brushing. I noticed results within a week of consistent brushing. It's not quite as effective as white strips, but good for slight improvement and maintaining your pearly whites!

The polish was easy to use and I think I saw an improvement in the whiteness of my teeth. The taste on both was fine for me. I was concerned about increased sensitivity due to the peroxide, but I'm happy to report that I did not experience any! The negatives: Even though overall brush time is still 2 minutes, the 2 product/2 step process makes brushing time a bit longer. Having to stop and then do a second step may discourage me from using the 2nd product if I'm in a rush. The fact that the polish does not open easily (one-handed), adds to the issue. Maybe a pump style dispenser similar to what Mentadent used to have, but tat keeps the 2 product separate, would be helpful.   304. This is not a horrible product, but it didn't work for me. I was invited to try Crest 3D White by receiving a free sample. I was hesitant to try Crest 3D White because of past experiences with the Crest brand. For some reason, Crest uses something in their products that makes my gums and soft tissue slough off. However, I've been using this product for almost 5 weeks and it hasn't had any sloughing effects. I've tried other teeth whitening products ranging from the trays to strips, but the only difference I noticed with them was chemical burns on my gums. So I was pleasantly surprised that Crest 3D White didn't burn my mouth. Aside from those benefits though, it didn't really leave my mouth feeling clean and I saw no visible difference in the look of my teeth. I think this product would work great for people who are regular coffee or tea drinkers or who have minor surface discoloration, but I guess I don't have surface stains. Overall, the product was simple and easy to use and didn't take any more time than it does to brush my teeth twice a day.

I have always looked for ways to brighten those outer teeth up. This 2 step system at first seemed like a bother to me but the more I used it, the more I liked it and liked the results.   310. I drink coffee everyday. Sometimes twice per day. I'm not willing to give up coffee for whiter teeth, but I am always looking for a toothpaste that will brighten my smile. I've tried dentist prescribed trays but those left my teeth sensitive for days. Through BzzAgent, I was able to try Crest 3D White for FREE! This is my second time trying out 2-step system that you do at home. Basically, I replaced my usual toothpaste for the Crest 3D White Brilliance Daily Cleansing & Whitening System. I use it morning and night. The first step is the toothpaste---it has a white color, mildly gritty consistency, and a refreshing mint flavor. I use this to brush my teeth. After 2 full minutes of brushing, spit. I actually notice (sorry if TMI) stains come off of my teeth into what I spit into the sink. If I brush right after coffee or food, I will see the color of the drink or food come off my teeth into what I spit into the sink. Then, I use a small amount of the whitening gel. This is a clear gel, it doesn't have as pleasant a taste as the toothpaste gel, but it is not off-putting. After using this for 2 minutes, I'm done. I experience no sensitivity and noticed brighter, whiter teeth after about 5 days of use. With consistent use, I find my teeth staying bright. If I don't use for a few days, my teeth aren't as bright. This takes about 1 minute longer than usual tooth brushing, because you are brushing with the toothpaste for 2 minutes, then the gel for about a minute, but it is worth it!

  312. I was given a free sample by the company to review but the opinions are my own. In fact, I am heading out to buy my own today. This product is everything I've come to expect from Crest. Then add the gel from the second tube to your brush and brush again for about a minute. The toothpaste itself isn't overly minty but it leaves a fresh clean feeling in your mouth. I have a sensitive mouth and the inside of my mouth wasn't irritated at all by this product. I noticed results almost immediately. Fresh breath and white teeth for an affordable price, what's not to love? Much cheaper than a dentist and easier/ quicker than the strips.

Anyone who has used Crest Whitestrips in the past will recognized the flavor of the gel (basically, hydrogen peroxide). The instructions state to use the product twice daily, and keep step 2 on your teeth for at least 1 minute each time. I didn't experiance any of the white spots on my teeth like I have in the past with the WhiteStrips, but I did get some gum soreness and bleeding. I like that this product doesn't really change my morning routine, and I think that I will continue to use it, but only after I get my teeth professionally whitened.

Additionally, I really like how clean my mouth feels after brushing and my teeth definitely do look whiter. While I don't have heavily stained teeth, I do drink more than one hit of coffee daily (hey I get up early and have small children) and my teeth have paid the price.<br /><br />It works in two steps, step 1 is to brush normally, then without rinsing your mouth or toothbrush, add the step 2 gel to your brush and brush again for about 1 minute. It doesn't take a whole lot of effort which is huge for me and the results are definitely visible. Not the best tasting toothpaste, especially step 2 which is easily recognizable for the peroxide that it is, but much easier and quicker than white strips and at ~$12 for the system in stores, it's definitely more wallet friendly as well. Plus, since you're brushing and I'm assuming you're doing that twice a day, you're being consistent with your whitening routine. For me, the hardest part about using products like whitening strips is to keep consistently using the product to obtain results. The deep cleansing tooth paste is more abrasive than most normal toothpastes and people, including myself, have a tendency to brush too roughly so when doing it with this type of toothpaste it can cause gum abrasions. After realizing this I started to brush more lightly and for no longer than a minute which is plenty of enough time. I've been setting a timer on my phone for two minutes which is helpful for not over-brushing. When brushing normally I like to brush three to four minutes so it took me a few times to get used to the reduced amount of time and mentally feeling like they were getting just as clean.<br /><br />I really would recommend this product especially for anyone who drinks a lot of coffee, tea or red wine. Just after a week it was such a noticeable difference that I was pleasantly surprised.   381. I received two full-sized tubes (one tube of &#34;Step 1&#34; and one tube of &#34;Step 2&#34; and they're color-coded!) in the mail for free from BzzAgent as a promotion from Crest brand. The first tube (cleansing toothpaste) is purple and the directions say to brush with this paste for one minute, spit, but DO NOT rinse. Then brush with the second tube (a white tube, the whitening gel) for one minute, spit, rinse with water. Those steps are easy-peasy compared to other whitening products on the market!<br />You're supposed to do these steps twice a day. If you're like me and brush at lunch time or additional times throughout the day, I've just been using the step one tube without the gel for those additional times.<br />Both the paste and the gel taste pretty good, which was a surprise to me! Most whitening products don't taste so pleasant. The toothpaste kind of reminds me of that &#34;bubble mint&#34; flavor of the blue toothpaste I used when I was a kid, and the gel has more of a cool mint flavor. My mouth feels fresh and clean when I'm finished brushing, and no weird after taste or filmy sensation is left behind. :)<br /><br />There is one thing I should mention: the first time I used this product, I saw a white spot on my gum on one side Immediately after using. I was prepared for it because it is written on the packaging as something to be aware of but I know some people don't always see things like that so I want to let you know it's nothing dangerous (and not painful or anything either). I had used it at night that time, and it disappeared by morning. :)<br /><br />As far as results go, I've been using the product for 4 weeks now and I have noticed a difference in the brightness of my smile. I wouldn't say it's a huge difference in whiteness per se, but I definitely think it's noticeably brighter. I think the best part isn't the whitening power but the squeaky clean feeling in my mouth after brushing.

Step 2 is a 2.3 ounce tube of &#34;whitening finisher&#34; that has several ingredients, but the main powerhouse is the Hydrogen Peroxide.<br /><br />The instructions are simple: Brush with the toothpaste for a minute, then spit but don't rinse. Preface: I received the Crest 3D White Brilliance Daily Cleansing & Whitening System as a free promotion from BzzAgent, in return for my unbiased opinion.<br />Initially, I was a bit put off by the two tubes. I brushed with the “deep cleansing toothpaste,” a gentle plaque-blaster, first. After a minute, and without rinsing, I brushed again for another minute with the “whitening finisher,” a clear gel polish. Easy enough.<br /><br />My teeth felt “fresh from the dentist” clean after two minutes, instead of 30 minutes in the dental hygienist chair. After a few days, my teeth are noticeably whiter.   497. Let me start by saying I am a daily user of Crest 3D white toothpaste, and have been for years. So if you're looking to decide if you should switch from the regular Crest 3D White toothpaste, to this two step Crest 3D White Brilliance Daily Cleansing & Whitening toothpaste, this review may help.<br /><br />To start, this toothpaste is a two part process. You brush your teeth with the first part, which is the cleansing part, and then spit it out. Do NOT rinse your mouth, only spit. After that, brush your teeth with the second tube. When you finish with that part, you can rinse it all out.<br /><br />The first tube, the cleansing toothpaste, is nearly intolerable to me. To aid in the cleansing (I assume), they made this paste EXTREMELY gritty. It feels like sand in my mouth. Not only is the texture strange, but the taste is stranger. I can barely last with this toothpaste in my mouth. Even if the texture wasn't awfully gritty, I don't think I would be able to accept the taste of this toothpaste.<br /><br />The second tube, which is what whitens your teeth, is a clear gel that doesn't taste nearly as bad to me. My mouth is quite sensitive to extremely minty toothpaste, so while using this two step process, my mouth felt like it was on fire. I'm not sure which tube caused that though. The gel is much more tolerable than the cleansing paste though.<br /><br />Overall, does this toothpaste whiten your teeth? I believe so. I do see my teeth whiter, because this toothpaste is probably removing some surface stains. Does it whiten better than the original Crest 3D white toothpaste? That I'm not sure of. My teeth normally respond well to whitening toothpastes and treatments, but I have never had my teeth professionally whitened. If this kid uses the original Crest 3D white as step one, followed by the whitening gel for part two, I would definitely consider purchasing. But honestly the first step just ruins the entire process for me, and makes it not worth paying more for.<br /><br />I did receive this product for free from BzzAgent, but that has absolutely no impact on my opinions. As I said, I am an avid user of other Crest 3D white line products, so I am not for or against this company in any way. This is just not the toothpaste for me!

In terms of taste, the cleansing toothpaste has a light mint taste which I am neutral about and the whitening paste tastes a bit like hydrogen peroxide - this didn't really bother me too much either as I didn't find the hydrogen peroxide taste overwhelming.   582. I was fortunate enough to try the Crest 3D White Brilliance Daily Cleansing & Whitening System compliments of Crest and BzzAgent! I was a bit skeptical at first, because I have used whitening toothpastes before that were worthless. However, I was pleasantly surprised by this product. My teeth are noticeably whiter! The other problem that I had with past products was that I was concerned that my teeth were not being adequately cleaned. With the 2 step process, I have no doubts that my teeth are being properly cleaned. The step 1 product is similar to other Crest mint toothpastes and the step 2 product is a gel product that tastes like hydrogen peroxide. Getting used to a 2 step process takes some time, but the system doesn’t really take up much more time than a traditional 2 minute brush. I have an electronic toothbrush that is on a 2 minute timer and beeps on 30 second intervals. Therefore, it is easy for me. On the second beep, I apply the step 2 product. It takes me mere seconds more to use this system. Overall, I love this product and would definitely purchase it in the future!

  584. I received the Crest 3D Brilliance through BzzAgent and was very eager to try it. As a treat to myself since I stopped smoking 4 years ago, I've gotten my teeth professionally whitened once a year. I usually get the one hour Zoom whitening done at my dentists office, and with regular cleanings, I consider myself to have an average shade of white teeth. I haven't gotten my whitening done in over a year, so I was eager to try this product at home and see if it actually worked.<br /><br />First and foremost, I drink A LOT of tea. Herbal tea, iced tea, black tea...you name it, I drink it. I'm kind of a tea fanatic, which is no Bueno for my chompers. I definitely have a little bit of tea staining on my teeth, but nothing terribly noticeable.<br /><br />Secondly, I have extremely sensitive teeth. Anything too cold or too sweet immediately sets my nerves on end (literally). I was apprehensive about using a whitening product without the &#34;sensitivity gel&#34; that my dentist will give me to use afterward.<br /><br />Thirdly, my mother and I both tried the regimen, and had slightly different findings.<br /><br />I used the regimen for about 2 weeks, and honestly didn't see much of a difference. My teeth might have been one shade whiter, but nothing really noticeable. I felt that the taste of the product was very tolerable, unlike other whitening toothpastes, but it did make my gums very sensitive, and I stopped using it after 2 weeks. I would probably not use this product on a regular basis because of the sensitivity issues, but it might be okay for use along with a sensitivity toothpaste as well. I will say that after using the toothpaste, my teeth were VERY shiny!<br /><br />My mother on the other hand had pretty stellar results with the regimen. She is staying the summer with me and has been using the 3D White twice daily for the last 2 weeks. She smokes, drinks coffee, and drinks tea. She has some moderate staining on her teeth. After 2 weeks of consistent use, her teeth are at LEAST 4 shades whiter. She also suffered with a tinge of sensitivity, but after switching to a softer toothbrush than her regular one, said that the sensitivity has lessened significantly. She thinks that at the regular price of around $15, she would continue to use it as a regular toothpaste if her dentist recommended her to do so.<br /><br />A few last thoughts:<br />We both had some concern about long term use as an everyday toothpaste. Is it safe? Will it do any damage to your teeth long term? We would not use this on a regular basis without a dentist recommendation.<br />We both had slight sensitivity issues, but for her it was not enough to stop. For me, it was.<br />We both felt that anyone who brushes their teeth for a minimum of 2 minutes each time they brush will likely see at least some kind of whitening regardless of the brand. I know I'm not in the minority here when I admit that I don't ALWAYS brush for a full 2 minutes 2-3 times a day.<br /><br />I feel that this whitening toothpaste could really benefit those who have moderate to severe staining on their teeth, but I'm not sure those who don't have significant staining will see much of a result. If you're looking for an inexpensive alternative to whitening and have a few weeks to allow the changes to take place, this is the product for you! If you're looking for a quick fix, or need a deep whitening, then this is probably not your best bet.

  634. I received the Crest 3D Brilliance Cleansing system for free thanks to Crest. Having recently got my adult braces off, I have been on a constant search for a quick, inexpensive whitening system. I've used whitening strips in the past but found the price, length of time it takes, and an issue with sensitivity to be against me. I've also tried the Crest HD system. While the HD system is similar, I received amazingly better results with the 3D Brilliance System. The 3D Brilliance kit contains two tubes. First is a Deep Cleansing toothpaste that you use for one minute. Then without rinsing, you follow up with tube 2 which is a whitening finisher. I found the first step to be tolerable. I didn't experience any burning or stinging due to sensitivity. It does seem to make my mouth somewhat dry but other than that it was not difficult. The second step is the polisher and this used in conjunction with a power brush is where the magic happens! Be careful around your gum line as white splotches can appear if you hold your brush there too long. (these fade away after a few minutes) I again did not experience any ill affects with step two. After both steps, I found my mouth to feel completely clean and fresh. There was a noticeable difference in the whiteness after the first use that just got better with each additional use. I find that if I use the 3D Brilliance kit at night and my 3D white in the am, it's the perfect combination. In conclusion, I believe the 3D Brilliance kit is an excellent kit and has the same if not better results than whitening strips or an office whitening system.

  637. I've been using the Crest 3D White Daily Cleansing and Whitening System for the past two weeks since I received it from BzzAgent and Crest for free to try and provide feedback. I am reviewing based on my initial reactions and will update my review after continued use. The system is comprised of two products. Step 1 is for for deep cleaning and Step 2 is a polishing/whitening agent. You use each step for one minute; spit after Step 1 but do not rinse. Step 1 seemed like regular toothpaste and had a similar &#34;taste.&#34; It did not seem to get very bubbly. I prefer a toothpaste with more &#34;suds&#34; because I feel like I get a better clean. With that said, however, I do feel like my teeth are cleaner than with my previous toothpaste. I also was not a fan of the &#34;not rinsing&#34; aspect before brushing with step 2. Gross. Step 2 didn't taste great but was much better than the traditional strips. You could faintly smell/taste the hydrogen peroxide but it was ok. The second time I used the product I could feel a slight tingling but no sensitivity which was nice. I did &#34;feel&#34; like it was working. Pros so far: motivates me to brush for a full 2 minutes and twice a day, not bad tasting, gentle whitening, not messy, not an extra product or time spent (just usual teeth brushing which you should be doing anyway. Cons: toothpaste doesn't get bubbly, whitening effects are gradual and not immediate, not supposed to rinse in between steps.

  651. I've been using this tooth paste for a little over 3 weeks now (I received it for free from BzzAgent to try and honestly review it), and I really like it.   652. I've used plenty of whitening products, but they all make my front teeth super sensitive. This gives me control over where to aggressively brush and where to leave be (i.e. bottom of front teeth) which white-strips cannot do. The Step 2 (polish) can irritate the gums at first (I only used it every other day in the beginning until my gums were acclimated to being stimulated more than usual). My teeth, and my husband's teeth have not been whiter since long ago! Keeps the coffee stains at bay, too. The only negative is the taste, but if you follow up with a good strengthening mouthwash, it goes away. Totally worth it. FYI I'm trying the product for free thanks to Crest® but my opinions are honest and my own.
  653. After using this product you can expect to have a DRY mouth. I mean super dry. The toothpaste feels gritty, and the gel tastes bad. I haven't seen any whitening effects, But I also don't think I'll continue to use it long enough to finish the kit off. The All day dry mouth just isn't worth it. I am always looking for a good whitening product because I have naturally yellow-ish teeth and drink tea quite often. I have had many great experiences with the Crest brand in the past, and this new product is no different! I like that there are 2 steps- the first is a deep cleansing regular toothpaste that tastes great (nice and minty) and the second is a targeted whitening gel. The instructions on the back of the tube say to use each for one minute, but I probably do a little extra with step one and a little less with step two because my teeth have been pretty sensitive to the peroxide in the whitener. Overall, my teeth do feel nice and clean as a result of using this system, but I think the whitening process has been a bit slow- I see some improvement in areas that were very yellow before but it's not getting as white as i hoped. However, I'm sure this is due to my reduced usage of step 2- I wish I could use more but the sensitivity to cold foods is just not worth it! I will continue to use this product

I've noticed that my teeth are slightly whiter and it's a much cheaper alternative than professional teeth whitening which I have had in the past. Prior teeth whiting treatments have led my teeth to become extra sensitive, but I have not noticed an increase in tooth sensitivity with use of this product. The taste is pretty gross, and my mouth feels a little dry after I brush with both tubes, but I think this toothpaste has more benefits to offer then drawbacks. The step 2 tastes just like other whitening products, not good, but tolerable (and it isn't like you are swallowing it).<br /><br />Like other reviews state you use step 1 for one minute, then without rinsing use step 2 for one minute.   667. I received a free sample from Crest of their 3D White Brilliance Daily Cleansing & Whitening System and here's what I think:<br />It's a 2 step process- The deep cleaning toothpaste and the finishing whitener. I think a 2 step process has its pros an cons. Pro: It may get me to brush for longer (certainly closer to the 2 minutes you are supposed to) and it gets my teeth REALLY smooth and clean. Con: It's super annoying, 2 tubes, 2 caps, stop in the middle, etc...<br />Taste: Not great... Its the same as many other similar Crest Pro-health or 3D series, it's probably the taste of the specific ingredient but it's not as fresh or minty as the Scope flavor which is my favorite toothpaste. Also the finisher is loose, goopy and runny and feels weird. If you don't use it though your mouth gets really dry from the toothpaste alone.<br />Clean: EXCELLENT! My teeth are so freaking clean feeling and smooth- I feel zero tartar<br />Price: Maybe worth it for excellent clean feeling, much more than other toothpastes. Will last ~ 1 month I think.<br />Whitening: I have not noticed a significant difference- but my teeth are pretty white anyways and I constantly use a whitening toothpaste. So if you were not using a whitening toothpaste and you went to this toothpaste maybe the results would be more dramatic.<br />Sensitivity: No issues, and I generally have these with whitening products<br /><br />Overall: A good toothpaste for whitening with EXCELLENT cleaning capability, mediocre taste and value for money.

It feels weird until I finally get to Step 2 which seems to stabilize everything and brings back the moisture. It's not a deal breaker at all however, it's just an odd feeling. Despite this, I definitely will use this product till it's finished and purchase in the future.<br /><br />*Thanks to Crest® for providing this product for me to review*

I am only giving it two stars because people with sensitive teeth do need to be aware that this toothpaste alone will make hell in your mouth. I used it every day for about a month before stopping since the warning said that the sensitivity would subside. However, it made it so bad that I couldnt brush my teeth without feeling like I was taking a knife to the most sensitive parts of my mouth. So I support this product, but people with naturally sensitive teeth need to find a different way to whiten. Unless you are willing to be in pain.
  716. I am not really impressed by this product. 2 steps in my opinion are not necessary when their clinical toothpaste does whitening too plus much much more! I've used a whitening gel on its own and that's all they need to sell. The taste of the polish is not that great either. I received this free as a promotional product. I would not purchase.

  722. Crest products are my favorite for tooth brushing, and mouth washing. That being said, I was disappointed with the claims of this product.   723. So crest has come out with another 2 step whitening toothpaste system. I love the first one I tried, the Crest Pro-Health HD Daily Two-Step Toothpaste System, but this one falls short. So I will stick with my loved Crest brand, just not this product.<br /><br />The process is simple, brush for one minute with step one. Spit, but don't rinse, and brush for one minute with step 2. Rinse and done.<br /><br />The problem with this system is in the paste itself. It is gritty and pastey with a fake sugar taste. I understand the theory of the gritty paste is &#34;buff&#34; off stains but I have not noticed any difference in the color of my teeth. Now perhaps that's a good thing, as Crest mentions in their Crest 3D commercials, &#34;If you're not whitening, you're yellowing.&#34; but when a product claims to be &#34;99% as white as a professional polish&#34; then I expect better results. I won't be purchasing this particular toothpaste again, but I do like the 2 step process, if for nothing else, it keeps me honest and I brush for the full 2 minutes.   770. I received the Crest 3D Brilliance Cleansing system for free thanks to Crest. I have been on a constant search for a quick, inexpensive whitening system for a while now. I've used whitening strips in the past but found the price, length of time it takes, and an issue with sensitivity to be against me. I've also tried the Crest HD system. While the HD system is similar, I received amazingly better results with the 3D Brilliance System. The 3D Brilliance kit contains two tubes. First is a Deep Cleansing toothpaste that you use for one minute. Then without rinsing, you follow up with tube 2 which is a whitening finisher. I found the first step to be tolerable. I didn't experience any burning or stinging due to sensitivity. It does seem to make my mouth somewhat dry but other than that it was not difficult. The second step is the polisher and this used in conjunction with a power brush is where the magic happens! Be careful around your gum line as white splotches can appear if you hold your brush there too long. (these fade away after a few minutes) I again did not experience any ill affects with step two. After both steps, I found my mouth to feel completely clean and fresh. There was a noticeable difference in the whiteness after the first use that just got better with each additional use. I find that if I use the 3D Brilliance kit at night and my 3D white in the am, it's the perfect combination. In conclusion, I believe the 3D Brilliance kit is an excellent kit and has the same if not better results than whitening strips or an office whitening system.

  781. I was excited to try Crest 3D White Briliance Daily Cleansing & Whitening System for free thanks to BzzAgent, but when I received it, I couldn't help but notice the similarities in packaging to Crest's Pro-Health HD two-step system, which I've been using thanks to a previous BzzCampaign. I happened to have the package laying around. The difference? Absolutely none, unless you count the &#34;blue 1&#34; coloring in the HD cleanser. Huh.<br /><br />So honestly, I'm not sure what the purpose is of selling a product under two different names, and that bothers me a bit.<br /><br />Onto the positives and negatives. I love how well the deep cleansing toothpaste cleans. My mouth has never felt cleaner than when I'm using this product (or the HD stuff, which is the same). And while I personally wasn't noticing significant whitening, I didn't exactly have the most yellow teeth to begin with -- and my dental hygienist went out of her way to ask me if I'd ever whitened my teeth before, because they looked so great. So I guess it must be working after all!<br /><br />What I really struggle with, though, are the two steps. I don't like the idea of doing each step for a minute, because I feel like I'm rushing through on both minutes and missing spots. As a result, I brush with the deep-cleansing toothpaste for two minutes, then follow up with the finisher for one minute. But this makes my overall brushing regimen take longer, which is frustrating. Also, when I'm half-asleep before bed, I commonly forget the second step altogether. I'm nervous about doing this too frequently because the active ingredient in the deep-cleansing toothpaste is known to stain teeth. I feel like the second step is there to help counteract that effect.<br /><br />I'm also pretty put off by the cost. While it works great, I just can't justify spending this much on toothpaste on a regular basis. But if you're really looking for a good clean, some pearly whites, and don't mind paying extra for that, the product definitely does work.

  797. At first glance I was skeptical. I have tried whitening products in the past with no success. I did not have high hopes for this one either. The packaging was fine. The cardboard bottom could have gotten wet and possibly torn, but that is a little thing. A two part system, hmmmm....not so sure about this. Time to test. Upon testing I first notice the taste and texture of part 1, it was gritty and had a mild minty type taste. Not bad. I figured the grittiness served to scrub the teeth. Now for part 2. This seems to be a gel form of peroxide. It did not have the best taste to it, but it was bearable. I noticed a burn with part 2. The bubbles filled my mouth as my gums burned. It was not the most enjoyable experience, but I knew that it was like putting peroxide on a dirty wound. My gums were sensitive throughout the day. I continued this process for two weeks. Around day 4 the burning stopped. I noticed around week 2 a slight whitening, not a major difference. Over the 2 weeks of trials, I no longer had an issue with the taste or burning. Overall I like the product. It is a little burdensome to have it in 2 different tube, especially if you have to travel.
  798. I got to try Crest 3D White Briliance Daily Cleansing & Whitening System for free thanks to BzzAgent. I love how well the deep cleansing toothpaste cleans. My teeth are generally pretty white, but they could always be whiter, and that just didn't happen with this toothpaste.<br /><br />I really don't like the two steps. I spend two minutes with each because I want to make sure all my teeth are cleaned properly but that then doubles my brushing time. Some days, I just don't have that extra time. I'm not sure whose to blame for that, but it is a turn off right off the bat.<br /><br />Overall, the deep cleaning really works and I love that. But it doesn't whiten much and it's just too expensive for toothpaste. I would recommend it to anyone who is willing to pay, just for the deep cleaning aspect.

  806. I'm in love with this toothpaste! I received this set in my Bzzz kit, and couldn't be happier! It not only tastes good, but it actually whitens! I seen results in a week. Visibly whiter!
  807. I drink coffee and tea. Needless to say, my teeth aren't as white as they could be, so in addition to my regular whitening toothpaste I resort to OTC whitening treatments from time to time. I received the Crest 3D White Brilliance 2-Step System for free, courtesy of BzzAgent, to try and review. Claiming to keep your teeth up to 99% as white as a professional polish/teeth whitening treatment, this product makes some tall claims.<br /><br />The two-step system is simple - brush with the blue tube for one minute, spit, then brush with the white tube for one minute. Implementing this regimen in place of your normal toothpaste is supposed to give you a dazzling, professional-grade smile.<br /><br />That is, if you can get past the taste. This toothpaste is sweetened with sucralose, which I find intolerable (as do many people). On top of the taste, it has an extra-gritty texture for increased abrasion. This is an old-school method of whitening because it essentially buffs away the stains...taking precious enamel with it. You can decide if the cosmetic results are worth the damage; for me, it isn't.<br /><br />The fluoride this product contains for anti-cavity purposes is not the usual one we see, sodium fluoride. This instead contains stannous fluoride which, surprisingly, can cause staining - and it is even disclaimed on the packaging! Makes a lot of sense in a whitening product.<br /><br />The whitening gel in step two is nothing more than a peroxide-based gel on steroids; you should probably not actually brush with this. Following the instructions turned my upper gums white in the single minute I used to brush; this is indicative of tissue damage. A product like this should ONLY be used with a tray that can isolate the gel to the tooth's surface, protecting the gums.<br /><br />I won't be using it again, and I definitely would not buy it. If you don't hate sucralose, have flawless, strong teeth, and only wish to lift everyday stains (like coffee), this may work for you. It is a pretty big fail for me.<br /><br />More details/review in greater depth at http://www.beautyskeptic.com/?p=3276

That being said, maybe that is not what this product is designed to do, but it is part of what I expected from a toothpaste. RESULTS. I have used this product consistently for about three weeks now, and continue to use it in hopes that I see some good results, but so far the lesson that I have learned is that good result pictures are all about the lighting! I took my before photo the day the product arrived and my teeth looked surprisingly white in natural light. two weeks later after consistently using the product I photographed my smile in my bathroom and found that my teeth looked more stained that at the start. If I flipped the photos I'm sure I could convince people that I got a great result from this product, but that's not what I'm here for. Best of luck and I hope you end up with better results than I did.

  879. Your Review [copy the whole text! Make sure they know you are part of the Army :) ]:<br />The Crest 3D White kit consists of a two step process with two separate tubes of paste.   902. Please know I received this system for free courtesy of Crest and BzzAgent, however the opinions are my own and I have purchased a system since then. I have been a user of Crest WhiteStrips from the very beginning. I have always liked the value but it has gotten a little too expensive for regular use when one use doesn't show much of a result. Thus I am blown away by the new Crest 3D White Brilliance Daily Cleansing and Whitening System!<br /><br />When I used WhiteStrips, I specifically had to wear them only at night as I knew they would cause pain and sensitivity for hours which could come and go while I slept. As you are only brushing with this new system, I did not think it could possibly be as effective as WhiteStrips, but I was wrong!<br /><br />The first Deep Cleansing toothpaste was a nice refreshing mint and seemed like the Crest toothpaste I usually use. After brushing for one minute with this, you spit and move on to the Whitining Finisher. Alright, by move on I mean put down toothbrush and unscrew the top to the finisher and carefully (it's a little liquidy) put it on toothbrush, screw top back on (or have finisher drip onto vanity), then brush! Would really like to see the finisher have a little more substance and be in a flip top.<br /><br />You then brush with the finisher for one minute, which is when the magic happens! I normally use an electric toothbrush, but recommend not turning it on for Step 2, as for me it spread the paste around too much, when I mainly want to whiten the teeth that show in a smile. Step 2 also gives a bit of a burn, but it's not necessarily bad, just seems refreshingly intense.<br /><br />I'm nitpicking at the tube and the consistency but the end result is AMAZING. Two minutes and my teeth are glowing!! The best part is that I have absolutely no pain or sensitivity. How is this even possible?! Crest, you have won me over with the amazing new Crest 3D White Brilliance Daily Cleansing and Whitening System!!!
